description.narrative: Strengthening national capacity to provide sustainable access to drinking water and adequate sanitation, which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Disaster Risk Reduction (Covid), Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Pregnant women, nursing mothers, and children under 5 have access and use equitable public and community facilities for the prevention and treatment of malnutrition, including in humanitarian situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthening national capacity to provide sustainable access to drinking water and adequate sanitation

description.narrative: UNICEF Comoros supported the national scale up, on the remaining two islands of Mwali and Ndzuwani, of the water services information system, with the ongoing mapping of water services and the introduction of water services quality monitoring. Standard WASH indicators were adopted in the national Education Management Information System; however, data is yet to be available. UNICEF continues to participate and contribute to reviews of the draft water and sanitation policy, especially building on our sanitation marketing experience. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of health centres that have basic WASH facilities

National monitoring systems reporting on equity of access to WASH services available
Operational information system for drinking water is in place
